body.name: K&F Concept Mini Tripod Stand, Flexible Camera Cellphone Tripod with Bluetooth Remote, 1/4'' Screw with Phone Holder&Cold Shoe, 6.6lbs Max Load Compatible with Smartphone/Canon Nikon Sony Camera
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 6 hrs 43 mins
features: 2-in-1 Design for Phone and Camera: The integrated phone and camera clip design ensures easy compatibility, allowing you to capture wonderful moments on the go.
Strong Load Capacity: Supporting up to 3kg/6.6lbs, this tripod is perfect for various devices including most mirrorless cameras and smartphones.

Flexible and Adaptable Legs: Its flexible legs can bend and adapt to various settings like lamp posts, railings, branches, bikes, or chairs, ensuring you can capture clear photos on tilted or smooth surfaces with ease.

360-Degree Ball Head for Versatile Shots: The 360-degree horizontal rotation and 90-degree vertical tilt capability of the ball head allow you to capture shots from various angles and perspectives, be it landscapes, portraits, or action scenes.

Durable and Slip-Resistant Construction: Crafted from special materials for durability, the tripod features resilient, flexible yet sturdy legs. It's resistant to breakage even after repeated bending, with high-quality silicone pads for enhanced grip and stability. Also, it's waterproof and corrosion-resistant, suitable for underwater shooting.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Just what I needed and I didn't spend an arm.and a leg for a quality product

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars great little tripod for phone use
reviews.reviewText: For the price, this is a nice little tripod. The flexible legs add a lot of options for how it can be positioned, and they feel very sturdy so I don't have any concerns about them not being able to do their job. The tripod head has a built-in phone holder, which snaps solidly into place when closed so that there's no concern over it coming open while storing or transporting the tripod.A few things that should probably be noted --1. This tripod is pretty short. It's best for use on a table, or possibly attached to something else with the legs wrapped (I haven't tried this). Used on the ground it will give you a low angle of view (which may well be what you want, but just be aware of it).2. The legs don't collapse at all, so tripod stays at full extension even for storage and transportation. Height of the tripod would be adjusted (as much as it's possible) through bending the legs. Depending on what you're doing, this may also affect the stability of the tripod, so just be aware of how stable it is when setting it down with the legs bent.3. While the tripod can be used for a small camera with the built-in 1/4" mounting screw, it is very clearly intended primarily for phone use.If all of these sound ok for your purposes, then don't hesitate to buy it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I sort of bought this on a lark to use as a tripod for non-camera things while hunting, but I actually find it very versatile, and I'm pleasantly surprised! I have used K&F filters on my cameras before and liked them. This is a handy little tripod that has flexible arms to adapt to various situations. What I liked most of all is how cleverly the phone holder is integrated into the head; it folds down when you're using it as a traditional tripod, but if you decide to use it for the cell phone on a whim, you don't have to fish out another attachment for that.It's not built very heavy duty, I believe many of the parts are plastic. But it doesn't feel cheap, and overall it was a nice surprise that I'm looking forward to using often.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good quality Flexible tripod to use with smartphones filming :)
reviews.reviewText: Good quality Flexible tripod to use with smartphones filming :)I mainly use this mini tripod to film or take picture with my S22 ultra.It hold my phone perfectly and very stable once you adjust the flexible legs to the surface.It is more stable than I thought originally and the flexible legs allows you to use on the uneven surface oron the handrail, trees brunches, etc...Super versatile

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Hardworking worthy addition to professional kit!
reviews.reviewText: This little tripod offers tremendous versatility, it's lightweight and great for packing. The legs are quite flexible, giving you not only height options but expanding where you can film from, as you can use them to wrap around or hang from infrastructure. The tripod attachment is also versatile with almost a 360-degree radius, and it comes apart to reveal a cold shoe and a 1/4 screw. I would not trust this with a heavier camera unless you were shooting from stable place where if it tips you won't be sorry. But this is great for smaller point and shoot cameras, phones and lights. It can also be used as the dreaded selfie stick but (preferably) you can use it for all sorts of tracking/gimbal shots, and it comes with a Bluetooth remote. Photographers know that you need to build up a robust kit, and this is a great addition. However, it would certainly also be great for Youtubers, travelers or just to have for capturing family moments or video chatting. This is a winner, and the price point is sweet!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My Go-To Tripod for On-the-Go Photography
reviews.reviewText: I snagged the K&F Concept Camera Tripod for my phone photography gigs, and wow, it's been a handy little companion. I can't speak for how it would buddy up with a heavy-duty camera, but for my phone, it's been nothing short of rock solid.There's this nifty integrated clip that flips between gripping my phone and could easily clutch a camera if needed. I'm pretty jazzed about how it bends every which way; I've wrapped it around tree limbs and park benches, making for some epic angles I didn't think were possible without sprouting extra arms.It feels tough, too—like it could take a tumble or a dunk and come out still snapping pics without a hiccup. Plus, the grip is top-notch, so no panic attacks when it's perched somewhere high or slick.And let's chat about that ball head—a smooth operator that lets me pivot from landscape to portrait without skipping a beat.All said and done, this tripod has been a solid pick. It's my trusty sidekick for all things photography now, and I've got a good feeling it'll stick around for plenty of shoots to come. Five stars, easily!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Good Tripod For The Price
reviews.reviewText: This is a sturdy, well-constructed tripod. The legs are flexible and hold their shape well when bent. I am using this tripod as a stand for my webcam, and it is plenty strong enough for that job. This tripod is plenty sturdy enough to do the job that it was designed for. I'd feel confident putting a smartphone or even a point-and-shoot camera on it. For light-duty applications, like just setting something on a flat surface where it won't get bumped, I think this tripod could also handle a mirrorless camera with a smaller lens, but that would be the upper limit of its capabilities. Overall, I'm very happy with this product. It is a good piece of gear for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works as advertise and very flexible
reviews.reviewText: This tripod is very flexible. It’s also pretty sturdy. I am a content creator and this tripod really comes in handy when I am creating my YouTube videos. I had a tripod like this before but this is a little bit better. It is perfect for when I travel and fits easily in my camera backpack. I like that it has a built-in phone holder. It also came with a little Bluetooth remote control in which I don’t use but it’s good to have anyway. It’s very adjustable. I have been using it with my canon T6i DSLR camera, gopro and with my iPhone 15 pro max without a problem. So far it has been working great for me. I plan on getting another one just for my GoPro. .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Very flexible and versatile although it can't be extended
reviews.reviewText: This tripod stands out with its impressive versatility, offering features not commonly found in similar products like selfie sticks that transform into tripods. The flexible legs, although thick, contribute to their robustness and durability. This flexibility proves invaluable when angling the cellphone downward, a situation that would typically make the setup top-heavy and prone to tipping over. The tripod's ability to spread its legs wider allows for stable photos even when facing downward. It's important to note that this might not be suitable for regular cameras due to their added weight compared to mobile phones.One potential drawback is the tripod's inability to extend its legs' height beyond forearm length. However, this seems a minor compromise when considering its adaptability to various surfaces.In summary, this tripod is a fantastic product with numerous practical applications.
Good build quality and also has a phone holder in the stand. Smart. Cheers
